heading: pacbell dsl suffers failure
subheading: pacific bell dsl customers in northern california experience a three-day-long network outage, with no estimates on when service will return.
author: wired news report
text: customers of pacific bell's dsl high-speed internet service in northern california have experienced network failures over the past three days. the carrier didn't disclose the cause of the outages and couldn't estimate when the problems would be repaired.some of pacbell's estimated 50,000 dsl customers in northern california started noticing the outage on tuesday and haven't been able to get onto the internet since.dsl, which offers "always on" high speed access to the internet, is a key offering by pacbell and its parent, sbc communications, to compete in the market for fast net connections. earlier this year, the carrier launched a $39.95 a month service special for residential customers, leading to a large increase in subscribers.the carrier said the outage affected only customers in northern california, and not those in texas and other regions where the company is building out its dsl service.
